intro: Carum ajowan, commonly known as black cumin, is an annual herb native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its small, oval-shaped seeds that are dark brown in color. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers, which are borne on slender stems. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine and cuisine. The essential oil extracted from its seeds contains compounds like thymol and carvacrol, which contribute to its medicinal properties.
